Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on free speech rights in a democratic society.
It allows a politically motivated group to control what is considered misinformation.
There are existing methods to control misinformation without new legislation.
The legislation erodes human rights and the Australian concept of a 'fair go'.
It grants excessive power to a small group, risking abuse and suppression of dissenting voices.
The legislation lacks detail on implementation and accountability.
It unfairly targets private businesses and individuals while exempting politicians, government departments, and mainstream media.
Notable Quotes: As a citizen of a free and democratic country we all have the right of free speech.
This legislation is an erosion of our human rights and everything I feel is Australian.
It is dangerous to allow so much power to a small group of people to determine what is true or not by their interpretation of select information.
This legislation is dangerously overreaching and has the potential to do extreme amount of damage to Australiaâ€™s reputation.
